body.header: Listen to the recording, which will play automatically, and follow the instructions. Click on the correct answers.

ol.li:
What is the Havasupai's main source of income?
a casino
tourism
farming

How do most visitors to the village arrive?
on foot
by road
by air

Why did the Havasupai feel imprisoned until recently?
Their village was difficult to leave.
They were surrounded by tourists.
They lost some of their original land.

Members of the Havasupai tribe mainly eat …
traditional tribal food.
fast food.
French food.

What happens to their rubbish?
It is flown out.
It is recycled.
It is burnt.

Most young Havasupai …
prefer their traditional music.
avoid watching television.
speak the native language.

The future of the village may lie in …
better educational opportunities.
attracting a new type of visitor.
breeding animals.

section.p: 1. The lecturer says 'they live off their visitors', in other words tourists.
2. The lecturer says 'to walk' is the only way of reaching the village.
3. The lecturer says 'part of their land was incorporated into the Grand Canyon National Park.' so they did lose some of their original land.
4. The lecturer says 'the locals prefer hamburgers, hot dogs and French fries' which is all fast food.
5. The lecturer says 'all the rubbish has to be removed by helicopter', so it is therefore flown out.
6. The lecturer says 'the young Havasupai people still speak their native language'.
7. The lecturer talks of having hunters come to the village who will pay large amounts of money to kill animals and that this will 'boost the village economy'.
